Package cosc202.andie

Class Andie

java.lang.Object
cosc202.andie.Andie
public class Andie extends Object

Main class for A Non-Destructive Image Editor (ANDIE).

This class is the entry point for the program. It creates a Graphical User Interface (GUI) that provides access to various image editing and processing operations.

CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

  • Method Details

    • langSet

      public void langSet()

      Launches the main GUI for the ANDIE program.

      This method sets up an interface consisting of an active image (an ImagePanel) and various menus which can be used to trigger operations to load, save, edit, etc. These operations are implemented ImageOperations and triggerd via ImageActions grouped by their general purpose into menus.

      Throws:
      Exception - if something goes wrong.
      See Also:
      • ImagePanel
      • ImageAction
      • ImageOperation
      • FileActions
      • EditActions
      • ViewActions
      • FilterActions
      • ColourActions

    • resizeWindowToImage

      public static void resizeWindowToImage(Dimension size)

      Fits ANDIE's window size to the current image size

      Updates the dimensions JFrame representing the window of the active ANDIE instance according to the dimensions of the current image being displayed. If the image is too large, the window will instead be set to the maximum size (the computer's screen resolution).

      Parameters:
      size - the size of the image

    • getFrameSize

      public static Dimension getFrameSize()

      Returns the dimensions of ANDIE's current window

      A method to retrieve the width and height of the JFrame containing the current ANDIE instance, i.e. the dimensions of the window currently being used for ANDIE. The method returns the resulting dimensions as a new Dimension object.

      Returns:
      A Dimension representing the size of the frame (includes width and height)

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception

      Main entry point to the ANDIE program.

      Creates and launches the main GUI in a separate thread. As a result, this is essentially a wrapper around createAndShowGUI().

      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments, not currently used
      Throws:
      Exception - If something goes awry
      See Also:
      • createAndShowGUI()
